title: Blockchain Large Language Models. (arXiv:2304.12749v1 [cs.CR])
abstract: This paper presents a dynamic, real-time approach to detecting anomalous blockchain transactions. The proposed tool, TXRANK, generates tracing representations of blockchain activity and trains from scratch a large language model to act as a real-time Intrusion Detection System. Unlike traditional methods, TXRANK is designed to offer an unrestricted search space and does not rely on predefined rules or patterns, enabling it to detect a broader range of anomalies. We demonstrate the effectiveness of TXRANK through its use as an anomaly detection tool for Ethereum transactions. In our experiments, it effectively identifies abnormal transactions among a dataset of 68M transactions and has a batched throughput of 2284 transactions per second on average. Our results show that, TXRANK identifies abnormal transactions by ranking 49 out of 124 attacks among the top-3 most abnormal transactions interacting with their victim contracts. translated_abstract: 本文提出了一种动态实时的检测异常区块链交易的方法。所提出的工具 TXRANK 利用链上活动生成跟踪表示，并从头开始训练一个大型语言模型，作为实时入侵检测系统。与传统方法不同，TXRANK 设计为提供无限制的搜索空间，并且不依赖预定义的规则或模式，使其能够检测更广泛范围的异常。通过将其用作以太坊交易的异常检测工具，我们证明了 TXRANK 的有效性。在我们的实验中，它在 6800 万笔交易的数据集中有效地识别出异常交易，并且平均批量吞吐量为每秒 2284 笔交易。我们的研究结果表明，TXRANK通过将 49 对 124 次攻击排名为与其受害合同交互最不正常的前三个交易之一，从而识别出异常交易。这项工作对区块链领域做出了贡献。
tldr: 本文提出了一种动态实时的区块链异常交易检测方法 TXRANK，它通过大型语言模型检测广泛范围的异常而无需预定义规则和模式，能够有效地检测以太坊交易中的异常交易。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a dynamic and real-time approach called TXRANK for detecting anomalous blockchain transactions using a large language model without predefined rules or patterns. It can effectively detect abnormal transactions among a wide range of Ethereum transactions and contributes to the field of blockchain transactions.
